messages.title: Not the Labour Party
messages.content: Labour has failed to stand up to the Government over its plans for a hard Brexit. Instead, on the crucial votes in Parliament, Labour MPs sided with UKIP to let the Tories get away with pulling the UK out of the single market.

messages.title: WHO WILL STOP THE HARD BREXIT?
messages.content: The Liberal Democrats are fighting the hard Brexit: The Liberal Democrats are determined to fight to keep Britain in the single market. Labour MPs have openly backed the damaging hard Brexit. Voting Labour won't change anything. But a Lib Dem vote can get a strong group of MPs committed to challenging the Tory hard Brexit. Lib Dems have ruled out a coalition with either Theresa May or Jeremy Corbyn. They are the only party capable of stopping the hard Brexit - and fighting to protect jobs.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Liberal Democrats are determined to fight to keep Britain in the single market and protect jobs.

issues.brexitEurope: The Liberal Democrats are fighting the hard Brexit and are determined to keep Britain in the single market.

endorsements.endorsement: The Liberal Democrats have vowed to fight on to retain single market membership after Brexit, after Labour was accused of throwing in the towel.

quotes.text: Labour's leading Brexiteer explains why it MUST be a 'hard' Brexit for Britain.
Jeremy Corbyn has betrayed us over Brexit. He is unfit to be called leader of the opposition.
Corbyn doesn't ask a single question about Brexit. On the day Article 50 is triggered, the Labour leader failed to hold the Prime Minister to account.
